author: KhabarOnline News Agency
title: Hamas tells Iran it can confront Israel in Gaza for months - KhabarOnline
text: Amir-Abollahian told a seminary meeting in the holy city of Qom on Thursday that more than 80 days have passed since the war on Gaza, but “the Zionist regime has not achieved anything”. "According to Hamas commanders, only 14% of the resistance capacity has been damaged so far," the foreign minister said. Amir-Adbollahian said the length of Hamas tunnels today is more than the area of Gaza, and drone manufacturing workshops have not been closed for even an hour since Operation Al-Aqsa Storm on Oct. 7. "Hamas captured valuable security and military forces of the Zionist regime on the first day of Operation Al-Aqsa Storm." The minister touched on the rising popularity of the resistance, saying Hamas administers both Gaza and the war now. “After the Al-Aqsa Storm, more than 70% of the people of Gaza took up arms and came to the battlefield,” he said. "After breaking the wall, all the Palestinian youth and people came to the arena and defended their country." The Zionist regime, meanwhile, has changed its goal of presence in Gaza several times, but has failed, he said. Amir-Abdollahian touched on all-out US support for the Israeli invasion of Gaza and Washington's repeated messages for Iran to stay out of the conflict since the onslaught began. “America rallied behind the invasion with all its might and constantly sent us a message that, ‘firstly, we do not seek to expand the scope of the war, and secondly, you advise your proxy groups in the region not to take action against us'. “At every stage, they were given a strong response and the establishment responded to them at the official level. “At the same time, we told them many times that we are not seeking to expand the war, but you are lying. If you are not looking to expand the war, your bases should not use this amount of facilities and weapons day and night against a limited area such as Gaza,” he said. MNA/PR

author: FOX 32 Chicago
title: Chicagoan becomes first Black woman licensee for Jeep clothing line
text:
CHICAGO - This Women's History Month , we continue to celebrate women who are creating their own lane.
One Chicago woman's love for Jeep completely changed her life.
Mariama Davis has gone from marketing assistant to a clothing licensee for Jeep. Starting earlier this year, her apparel is now in 15 Jeep dealerships across the country, making her the first Black woman licensee with the brand.
"It's been a love story from the beginning when Davis bought a Jeep Wrangler during the pandemic. She wanted to represent the Jeep brand and the community but had a hard time finding apparel that matched her message and style."
In 2020, her business expanded across the United States with her online store and an Etsy shop. Her brand then gained international attention, leading to notice from Jeep in 2022.
"January 13th at 8:58 a.m., they call me. They actually sent an email and they had taken notice of what I had been doing, you know, the Jeep events and the Etsy sales, and they reached out to me and said that they wanted to have a conversation," said Davis. "For two years, people didn't believe it was going to happen. It was just, ‘Mariama, oh girl, never. And then for it to happen, I'm just hoping. I'm hoping that this inspires so many other people."
The clothing celebrates the different shades of the Black and Brown communities.
To learn more, visit her website melanineditionapparel.com .

author: Mark Moran
title: U.S. State Department raises alarm as IAEA report details Iran's growing uranium production
text:
Dec. 28 (UPI) -- Iran increased its production of enriched uranium by 60% percent at its Natanz and Fordow facilities in the first six months of this year, the State Department announced Thursday, citing a new report from the International Atomic Energy Agency.
This increase in nuclear material is a "backwards step," the IAEA said in its new report. Advertisement
"We condemn this action, which adds to the unabated escalation of Iran's nuclear program," the IAEA said. "The production of high-enriched uranium by Iran has no credible civilian justification and the reported production at the Fordow Fuel Enrichment Plant and the Pilot Fuel Enrichment Plant further carries significant proliferation-related risks.
"We also take note of Iran's decision to revert to the same cascade configuration as the one discovered by the IAEA in Fordow earlier this year," the IAEA said. "Iran's delay in declaring this change in January 2023 cast serious doubts on Iran's willingness to cooperate with the IAEA in full transparency." Advertisement
The State Department said Iran's decision to increase its enriched uranium production demonstrates a lack of good will and represents reckless behavior in an already tense geographic region engaged in a race to increase nuclear material.
The State Department urged Iran to de-escalate its nuclear program and reinstate nuclear inspectors that it suspended in September, and it called on the country to assure the IAEA that its nuclear program is "exclusively peaceful."
"We remain committed to a diplomatic solution and reaffirm our determination that Iran must never develop a nuclear weapon," the State Department said in a statement.
Repeated use of sanctions
The Biden administration placed new sanctions on Iran in March, targeting the country's petroleum and petrochemical trade, an attempt to hinder Iran's ability to produce chemical and biological weapons. It was another move to further limit Tehran's energy industry amid concerns over its widening nuclear program.
Six companies, including two based in China and one in Vietnam, were blacklisted in March along with nearly two dozen shipping vessels that had been accused of engaging in the transport or sale of Iranian oil products.
"The United States is committed to significantly reducing Iranian energy exports and will sanction those facilitating Iran's petroleum and petrochemical trade," the State Department said in a statement in the Spring. Advertisement
"These designations underscore our continued efforts to enforce our sanctions against Iran. We will not hesitate to take action against those who try to circumvent our sanctions."
Washington has repeatedly placed sanctions on Iran aimed at crippling the country's oil industry since former President Donald Trump removed America from a multi-nation agreement signed under Barack Obama designed to prevent Tehran from stockpiling enough material to build a nuclear weapon.
Iran's repeated actions
Iran has repeatedly reneged on its responsibilities under the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action under the direction of its spiritual leader of Ali Khamenei .
Attempts by the Biden administration to reach a new deal with Iran have fallen short despite several rounds of negotiations.
Tensions escalated in the spring when the IAEA said it was in discussions with Tehran over "recent agency verification activities," after Bloomberg reported the agency detected Iran had enriched uranium to 84% purity.
Weapons-grade uranium is commonly considered to be enriched to 90%.
Read More Iran test fires new ballistic missile capable of reaching Israel U.S. imposes fresh sanctions targeting Iran's petroleum, petrochemical trade U.S. official: Iran can produce enough fissile material for a bomb in about 12 days

author: @portalmvd
title: Ahí va: cómo avanza la tormenta que azotará a Uruguay el sábado y cuál es el fenómeno
text: Montevideo Portal Este fin de semana se prevé con tormentas y lluvias fuertes, por lo que el Instituto Uruguayo de Meteorología (Inumet) [emitió una advertencia ](https://www.montevideo.com.uy/Noticias/Inumet-emitio-aviso-por-tormentas-fuertes-y-precipitaciones-abundantes--para-cuando--uc905080)que afectará a todo el país desde este viernes. De acuerdo con el organismo, la peor parte de las tormentas serán en el norte y suroeste del territorio nacional y en el resto del país se pueden dar precipitaciones aisladas. Actualmente, según muestran los modelos que utiliza Windy, algunas tormentas aisladas ya están sobre departamentos de Uruguay y allí rige [una doble advertencia emitida por Inumet. ](https://www.montevideo.com.uy/Noticias/Inumet-emitio-una-alerta-amarilla-y-otra-naranja-por-mal-tiempo-mira-a-donde-afectan-uc905115) Sin embargo, el grueso de las precipitaciones llegarán desde territorio argentino. Actualmente, las tormentas se encuentran en el centro del territorio de Argentina y se espera que se muevan durante las próximas horas hacia tierras locales. Lo que sucede en Argentina es un sistema frontal con precipitaciones y tormentas, algunas de ellas puntualmente fuertes. Montevideo Portal

author: Anamaria Rodríguez"/>
title: Necesitamos militarizar el corredor de la vía al llano: Gob. Cundinamarca sobre seguridad
text:
Durante el último año la vía al llano ha vivido distintas situaciones que han dificultado la movilidad de los viajeros y los trasportadores, derrumbes, atentados y accidentes, son algunos de estos incidentes. Igualmente, en el último mes han ocurrido distintos sucesos, por ejemplo, los dos accidentes que mantuvieron cerrada la vía en las últimas horas.
En cuanto al tema de los atentados, en diciembre ocurrieron dos ataques, ambos en peajes de la vía . El primero ocurrió el pasado 11 de diciembre, en el peaje de Boquerón, en el municipio de Chipaque, Cundinamarca, cuando tres explosivos fueron detonados; el segundo, ocurrió una semana después, en el peaje de Pipiral, muy cerca de Villavicencio, cuando también fue dentado material explosivo , las autoridades ya dieron las conclusiones de la situación.
Sobre esta situación, el Gobernador de Cundinamarca, Nicolás García, habló en Caracol Radio sobre la necesidad de militarizar el corredor de la vía al llano, por la llegada y presencia de grupos al margen de la ley en algunas zonas del departamento por la que pasa esta importante vía.
Militarización de la vía al llano En cuanto al tema de seguridad en el departamento, el Gobernador de Cundinamarca, Nicolás García, habló sobre lo que le preocupa y la situación que se vive en la vía al llano, García aseguró qué: “hoy el departamento de Cundinamarca tiene una preocupación y es la llegada de grupos armados al margen de la ley al corredor de la vía al llano ”.
García aseguró que hace algunos meses la gobernación tuvo una alerta en el corredor del Sumapaz, Pandi, Venecia y Cabrera y el departamento del Meta, por lo que se desplegó la operación ‘Ezequiel’, donde la decimotercera brigada hace presencia permanente, “hoy necesitamos que esa misma operación se despliegue al corredor de la vía al llano, por la concesión de Coviandina”.
Estas declaraciones se dan luego de que hace algunas semanas se presentaran dos hechos violentos en este corredor vial, el primero una explosión de tres granadas en el peaje Boquerón, y el segundo, en jurisdicción del Meta, en el peaje de Pipiral.
LE puede interesar:
Dos vías alternas para llegar a los Llanos permanecen habilitadas en Boyacá Inversión en vías terciarias de Cundinamarca alcanzó los 120 mil millones de pesos: Nicolás García Debido a esos hechos, García afirma que “tengamos la necesidad de militarizar y de tener mayor presencia de nuestro ejército en ese corredor” , igualmente afirmó que en el resto del departamento existe tranquilidad frente a la presencia de grupos armados al margen de la ley.
Cómo está la vía al llano Luego del cierre de la vía al llano por dos accidentes presentado en las últimas horas en el túnel Mesa Grande, ocurridos en horas de la mañana del jueves 28 de diciembre, Coviandina, encargada de la administración, la operación y el mantenimiento de la vía Bogotá Villavicencio, anunció que el corredor estaba habilitado nuevamente para el flujo de vehículos, casi a las nueve de la mañana.
En su último reporte, publicado en su cuenta de X, antes Twitter, Coviandina confirma que la movilidad avanza con normalidad en el sentido Bogotá-Villavicencio, mientras que las autoridades mantienen un cierre total en el K0+000 y el K83+000 en cumplimiento con el horario establecido por el Puesto de Mando Unificado.
Tenga en cuenta que si va a viajar por este corredor vial deberá estar atento a los reportes que Coviandina publica en sus redes sociales, y a la información emitida por la Policía de Tránsito y Transporte.
